text: Mannequin is a 1926 American silent romance film produced by Famous Players- Lasky and distributed by Paramount Pictures. James Cruze directed and Alice Joyce, Warner Baxter, and Dolores Costello were the stars. The film is still extant.The American Film Institute Catalog, Feature Films 1921-30 c. 1971 by The American Film InstituteThe Library of Congress American Silent Feature Film Survival Catalog: MannequinCatalog of Holdings The American Film Institute Collection and The United Artists Collection at The Library of Congress, p. 112, c.1978 by The American Film InstituteMannequin at The Alice Joyce Website, by Greta De Groat ==Cast== *Alice Joyce as Selene Herrick *Warner Baxter as John Herrick *Dolores Costello as Joan Herrick *Zasu Pitts as Annie Pogani *Walter Pidgeon as Martin Innesbrook *Freeman Wood as Terry Allen *Charlotte Bird as Toto (credited as Charlot Bird) uncredited *Bess Flowers as Mannequin *Marcia Mae Jones as Little Girl ==References== ==External links== * * *Film poster (Wayback Machine) *Lantern slide plate advert, coming attractions Category:1926 films Category:American silent feature films Category:American films Category:Films directed by James Cruze Category:Famous Players-Lasky films Category:1920s romance films Category:American black-and-white films Category:American romance films Category:Films based on works by Fannie Hurst
title: Mannequin (1926 film)
